summary: The Essential Air Service Reliability Act of 2025 aims to improve the reliability of essential air service in the United States. It mandates that companies applying to provide compensated basic essential air service include a contingency plan to maintain service during disruptions, excluding weather-related events. The bill amends existing sections of U.S. Code to this effect, including ensuring the new requirement is implemented within 180 days of enactment. It also clarifies compensation guidelines.
